rule1.name: Invalid Attribute value for null
rule1.message: Invalid 'null' value for attribute <%= attribute_name %>, please provide value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule2.name: Invalid Attribute value for controlled terms
rule2.message: Attribute value is not in controlled terms for attribute '<%= attribute_name %>'.

rule3.name: Duplicated sample title in this account
rule3.message: Sample title is duplicated in the submission account.

rule4.name: Taxonomy name and id not match
rule4.message: Organism and taxonomy id do not match.

rule5.name: Invalid BioProject accession
rule5.message: Invalid BioProject accession: <%= value %>. Please provide a valid BioProject accession with format PRJDxxxxxx or PSUBxxxxxx

rule6.name: BioProject not found
rule6.message: BioProject accession <%= value %> does not exist. Please provide a valid BioProject accession.

rule8.name: Invalid country
rule8.message: Entered country is not in controlled terms for attribute '<%= attribute_name %>'.

rule11.name: Invalid publication identifier
rule11.message: Invalid publication identifier, enter pubmed id, DOI or URL.

rule14.name: Not predefined Attribute name
rule14.message: Not predefined attribute name: attribute '<%= attribute_name %>'.

rule18.name: Missing sample name
rule18.message: Sample name is missing for <%= count %> sample(s).

rule20.name: Missing organism
rule20.message: Organism is missing for <%= count %> sample(s).

rule21.name: Identical samples
rule21.message: These samples have the same Sample Names and identical attributes. If these are duplicates, please delete one. If they really are 2 different samples, provide a unique Sample Name for each.

rule22.name: Identical Sample Names
rule22.message: These samples have the same Sample Names and different attributes. If they are different samples, please provide a unique Sample Name for each

rule24.name: Identical Attributes
rule24.message: Your sample upload failed because multiple BioSamples cannot have identical attributes. You should have one BioSample for each specimen, and each of your BioSamples must have differentiating information (excluding sample name, title, bioproject accession and description). This check was implemented to encourage submitters to include distinguishing information in their samples. If the distinguishing information is in the sample name, title or description, please recode it into an appropriate attribute, either one of the predefined attributes or a custom attribute you define. If it is necessary to represent true biological replicates as separate BioSamples, you might add an 'aliquot' or 'replicate' attribute, e.g., 'replicate = biological replicate 1', as appropriate. Note that multiple assay types, e.g., RNA-seq and ChIP-seq data may reference the same BioSample if appropriate.

rule26.name: Unknown Package
rule26.message: Sample refers to unknown Package '<%= package %>'.

rule27.name: Missing mandatory Attribute
rule27.message: Sample has missing mandatory attribute(s). If you do not have information for the required field(s), please provide value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule28.name: Duplicate Sample Names
rule28.message: The following Sample Names were used in submission more than one time: <% names %>. Please provide unique Sample Names.

rule29.name: Failure to parse batch submission file
rule29.message: Unable to parse batch file: quoted text possibly split across multiple lines.

rule30.name: Non-ASCII header line
rule30.message: Unable to parse batch file: the header line contains non-ASCII characters. Please check that uploaded file is in text tab-delimited format, not Excel.

rule31.name: Invalid Attribute value
rule31.message: These attribute values are not valid so please correct the data. Refer to http://trace.ddbj.nig.ac.jp/biosample/attribute_e.html for required format descriptions. If you do not have information for the required field(s), please provide the value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule35.name: Missing Attribute value
rule35.message: Empty attribute value for attribute '<%= attribute_name %>'.

rule36.name: Missing group of at least one required Attributes
rule36.message: Sample has missing attribute(s), at least one the the following <%= group_name %> attributes is required. If you do not have information for the required field(s), please provide value as either 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing'.

rule37.name: Empty column name
rule37.message: Unable to parse batch file: the header line has empty column name.

rule38.name: Non-UTF8 input
rule38.message: Unable to parse batch file: some values cannot be converted to UTF8 encoding.

rule39.name: Invalid Attribute value with autofix
rule39.message: These attribute values are not valid. An automatically-generated correction will be applied.

rule40.name: Future collection date
rule40.message: Sample collection date is a future date, please specify a date from the past.

rule43.name: Revised taxonomy warning
rule43.message: Provided taxonomy information was revised according to NCBI Taxonomy database rules. Please contact biosample@ddbj.nig.ac.jp if you have any questions.

rule44.name: Taxonomy consult warning
rule44.message: Submission processing may be delayed due to necessary curator review. Please check spelling of organism, current information could not be resolved automatically and will require a taxonomy consult.

rule45.name: Taxonomy error warning
rule45.message: Submission processing may be delayed due to necessary curator review. Please check spelling of organism, current information generated the following error message and will require a taxonomy consult: <%= message %>.

rule46.name: Latlon versus country warning
rule46.message: Values provided for 'latitude and longitude' and 'geographic location' appear to contradict each other: <%= message %>.

rule48.name: Package versus Organism
rule48.message: Organism is inappropriate for package. Please either specify a different sample type package or edit the organism according to the 'Appropriate organism and package' rules described at

rule58.name: Non-ASCII Attribute value
rule58.message: Non-ASCII format characters detected. Please check for non-standard characters in your attribute values and reformat as ASCII-only so that data can be properly consumed by dependent databases, including GenBank and Taxonomy.

rule59.name: Sex for bacteria
rule59.message: Attribute 'sex' is not appropriate for bacteria

rule60.name: Non-ASCII identifier
rule60.message: Non-ASCII format characters detected in Sample Name. Please format as ASCII.

rule61.name: Multiple Attribute values
rule61.message: Multiple values detected for '<%= attribute_name %>'. Only one <%= value %> is allowed.

rule62.name: Multiple vouchers
rule62.message: Multiple voucher attributes (specimen voucher, culture collection or biologic material) detected with the same <%= institution_code %>. Only one value is allowed.

rule63.name: Missing header sample_name
rule63.message: Required field 'sample_name' is missing from the header line of the file.

rule64.name: Missing header organism
rule64.message: Required field 'organism' is missing from the header line of the file.

rule65.name: Non-ASCII Organism
rule65.message: Non-ASCII format characters detected in organism. Please format as ASCII.

rule69.name: Warning about BioProject increment
rule69.message: Consecutive BioProjects are referenced in this submission. This is often a mistake caused by incrementing autofill in Excel, please check your file.

rule70.name: Invalid BioProject type
rule70.message: BioProject <%= value %> is an Umbrella project, not a primary data type of BioProject. Please provide the accession of the correct primary data BioProject or create a new BioProject, if necessary.

rule72.name: Unknown Attribute value
rule72.message: Submission processing may be delayed. The value '<%= value %>' provided for Attribute '<%= attribute %>' requires curator review.

rule73.scope: organism, attribute.host, attribute.strain, attribute.isolate, attribute.isolation_source, attribute.breed
rule73.name: Redundant taxonomy attributes
rule73.message: Redundant values are detected in at least two of the following fields: organism; host; strain; isolate; isolation source; breed. For example, the value you supply for 'host' should not be identical to the value supplied for 'isolation source'. This check is case-insensitive and ignores white-space.

rule74.name: package_vs_organism > Pathogen: clinical or host-associated
rule74.message: Must have lineage Bacteria, Viruses or Fungi, to species-level

rule75.name: package_vs_organism > Pathogen: environmental/food/other
rule75.message: Must have lineage Bacteria, Viruses or Fungi, to species-level

rule76.name: package_vs_organism > Microbe
rule76.message: Must have lineage Bacteria, Archaea, Viruses, Viroids or Fungi; or for unicellular eukaryotes, Must not have lineage Metazoa, Embryophyta, unclassified sequences or other sequences

rule77.name: package_vs_organism > Model organism or animal
rule77.message: Must NOT be Homo sapiens or have lineage Bacteria, Archaea, Viruses or Fungi

rule78.name: package_vs_organism > Metagenome or environmental
rule78.message: Must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'

rule81.name: package_vs_organism > Plant
rule81.message: Must have lineage Viridiplantae, or be known to have plastids

rule83.name: package_vs_organism > MIMS Environmental/Metagenome
rule83.message: Must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'

rule84.name: package_vs_organism > MIGS Cultured Bacterial/Archaeal
rule84.message: Must have lineage Bacteria or Archaea

rule88.name: package_vs_organism > MIMARKS Survey related
rule88.message: Must be a metagenome, where lineage starts with unclassified sequences and scientific name ends with 'metagenome'

rule91.name: Duplicated locus tag prefix
rule91.message: Locus tag prefix <%= value %> is duplicated.
